Class BoardRenderer

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.view.BoardRenderer
public class BoardRenderer extends Object
Responsible for rendering the game state onto the JavaFX scene.

This class manages the grid of rectangles that represent the background, the active falling piece, the ghost piece projection, and the preview panels.

    • setEventListener

      public void setEventListener(InputEventListener eventListener)

    • createGrid

      private javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[][] createGrid(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane, int rows, int cols)
      Helper method to initialize a grid of rectangles in a given Pane.

      Creates a 2D array of transparent rectangles and adds them to the scene graph. This method is used to initialize the Ghost, Active, Hold, and Next grids efficiently.

      Parameters:
      pane - The parent container for the rectangles.
      rows - Number of rows in the grid.
      cols - Number of columns in the grid.
      Returns:
      A 2D array of the created Rectangle objects.

    • initGameView

    • renderCentered

      private void renderCentered(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[][] targetGrid, int[][] shape, double paneWidth, double paneHeight)
      Renders a tetromino shape centered within a preview pane.

      Calculates the pixel-perfect center based on the shape's bounding box width/height and the pane's dimensions, ensuring visual alignment for odd-width pieces.

      Parameters:
      targetGrid - The grid of rectangles to use for rendering.
      shape - The 2D array representing the shape to draw.
      paneWidth - The width of the container pane.
      paneHeight - The height of the container pane.
